result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Joanna L. Knuckles

defendant.name: Knuckles, Joanna L.

records.addlTxt: Atty Duren received and waives reading of Information.  DE advised of charges and penalties.  Atty Duren stands Mute, Court enters Not Guilty Plea.  Atty Duren believes there is a potential resolution.  Atty Duren does not have an offer at this time but will be meeting with his client next week in hopes to discuss any offer.  Br. 2 JA will schedule an internal review in 2 weeks to determine further scheduling.  DE confirms address.

9:59 AM Defendant Joanna L. Knuckles in court.  Attorney Blake Duren in court for Joanna L. Knuckles.  Prosecuting attorney Rick C Spoentgen in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Court finds waiver to be free, knowing and voluntary.  Court finds probable cause, bind over for Br 2.

1:11 PM Prosecuting attorney C. Remington McConnell in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Joanna L. Knuckles in court.  Attorney Blake Duren in court for Joanna L. Knuckles.  Court states cases and appearances.  Atty Duren requests PH.  Bond continued.  TR matters to track.
Preliminary hearing and Arraignment scheduled for October 20, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Preliminary hearing and Arraignment on October 20, 2022 at 10:00 am.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: 1:52 PM Defendant Joanna L. Knuckles in court. Court reviews financial information.  Court finds conditionally indigent.   Court appoints Attorney Blake Duren @$100/hr and reimbursement @ $100.00/month commencing  9/1/22.

records.descr: Pet for appointment counsel,affidavit of indigency

records.addlTxt: Indigency hearing on July 27, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Not to oper MV w/out valid DL, absolute sobriety if operating MV and must submit chemical testing by law enforcement. No presence in bars/taverns/liquor stores.

2:47 PM Prosecuting attorney Gabriel David Arevalo in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Joanna L. Knuckles appeared by video, in custody.  Plaintiff State of Wisconsin in court.  Court states case and appearances.  DE doesn't qualify for PD appt.  Defendant received and waives reading of complaint.  Court advises DE of charges/max penalties.  Advised of rights to an attorney.  State makes bail argument.  Atty Getsinger responds.  Time limits waived for preliminary hearing.  22TR4112 and 22TR4113 to track.  $1.500.00 signature bond set.  Special bond conditions as follows:  No presence in bars/taverns/liquor stores, absolute sobriety if operating a MV, not to operate a MV w/o a valid DL, must submit to testing if requested by law enforcement and absolute sobriety at all times.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for July 22, 2022 at 10:15 am.
Return date scheduled for August 16, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Return date on August 16, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Pre-trial conference on July 22, 2022 at 10:15 am.
